data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: block number isometry
Readability: easy
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

This watchface is made of blocky numbers built up from the depth of your wrist. They are presented in an isometry view. with different shades to achieve a slight a 3D effect.

If you like minimalism and blocks, come grab Elevation!

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow

data.description:
More for your Pebble (Face version).

This is the Face version of WatchApp "More for your Pebble"

main features:

 - Large Clock and Date
 - Digital/Analog style
 - "Shake to light" only during custom period.
 - Display face in reverse mode.
 - Meteo information (or custom text) in the middle
 - Show/hide seconds.
 - Custom abbreviations for day of week 
 - Sleep time:
        - turn off/on bluetooth on phone (*)
        - hide seconds
 - Indicator for:
        - Pebble battery status
        - Bluetooth connection status
        - Phone battery status (*)
        - SMS unread (*)
        - Missed Calls (*)
        - Phone volume status (*)
 - Alerts with vibrations:
        - on Pebble connected
        - on Pebble disconnected
        - every hour
        - on phone battery below 5% (*)

(*) only with free companion app for Android ("more for your pebble")!
data.title: More for your Pebble - Face version

data.description:
This watchface will take you on a trip around the world ! Just use the default random mode to find a new city skyline displayed on your wrist every two hours.  Or choose a fixed skyline, while more are added on a regular base.  Now featuring a 'Night mode' in which the watchface inverts and shows a starry sky during night time.  

Also includes a date and battery indicator.

- Added city of Dresden

data.description:
Battery is the top bar which steps down in 20% increments. When empty the battery is below 20%.

Bottom bar is the Bluetooth connection.

Month+Date will alternate depending on if the hour is even or odd.

Settings will be added later. Pebble time version will most likely also come later with colour options hopefully.

data.author: @eMBeeGames

changelog.release_notes: - Added menu image

A watch face inspired by the Sinclair ZX Spectrum from 1982! 

Displays:
- Time (12/24 hour format based on preferences)
- Day and date
- A random Spectrum BASIC keyword (changes every minute)
- Bluetooth connection status (vibrates on disconnect)
- Battery percentage

Features:
- Sinclair logo optimised for B&W or colour Pebble
- The original Spectrum font
- Animated loading screen every minute (colour on Pebble Time)

Coming in the next version:
- Switch each screen element on/off
- Customise the colours using the original 16-colour Spectrum palette (Pebble Time only)

Please email/tweet me with feedback - @eMBeeGames

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Color bars instead of numbers.
Readability: hard, easy if you know
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

This is a minimalistic style version of the Resistor watchface. Check out the Pi version with numbers!

Resistor is a fun watchface with a scientific background. It is a derivation of my Spectrum watchface but this time it's based on the resistor color code. So electricians and DIYers might know the colors already while others just see wrist decoration.

Check out the color reference chart in the preview section!

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow

Special thanks to Tyler Bules who had the idea to use resistor colours.
data.title: Resistor Gamma

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Color bars instead of numbers.
Readability: easy
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

This is a minimalistic style version of the Resistor watchface. The Pi version has numbers below to help you read the time and actually to train you to read the other Resistor versions.

Resistor is a fun watchface with a scientific background. It is a derivation of my Spectrum watchface but this time it's based on the resistor color code. So electricians and DIYers might know the colors already while others just see wrist decoration.

Check out the color reference chart in the preview section!

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow

Special thanks to Tyler Bules who had the idea to use resistor colours.
data.title: Resistor Pi

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.description:
Tenji (点時) is Japanese and can be translated to “dotted time”. The basic idea is using classic digits and replacing each horizontal line segment by a dot. 

The digits are aligned in a dynamic angle, so you may tilt your head slightly to the right to read the four digits along the diagonal of the case. At the bottom, A (am) or P (pm) is displayed.

Note that when Quick Views appear, the time is shown, but the AM/PM is hidden.


Screenshots:  
 (1) 12:58AM
 (2)   9:36PM
 (3)   5:47AM
 (4)   6:25PM
 (5)   7:34 (with Quick View)


Design from the Tokyoflash Design Studio, created by Heather Sable Villano and Sam Jerichow.  The watchface has been produced with the designers' permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash. 

The original design can be found here:  
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2011/11/30/tenji-lcd-digital-watch-design-cleverly-hints-at-numbers/

If you like this, checkout sanctioned Tokyoflash watchfaces I have published.   Click on "More from this Developer".
Also check out the ones Sam has published - search for his last name: Jerichow

latest_release.release_notes: Support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.title: Tenji

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Double hexagon numbers
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

The time is told in 4 digital numbers, that are created each by two separate hexagons. This separation adds a little crypticness, if you see each hexagon as a unit. Once you passed the barrier of abstraction, it's easy. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2011, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Hex Z

changelog.release_notes: Weather My Way edited by Zeduaz - INVERTED

data.description:
Another weather watchface with weather forecast. 

Edited watchface Weather My Way - INVERTED. 

Location services on your phone must be enabled and always on because location is automatically determined. Battery status 1 full dot = 10% of battery. 
For hourly forecast needed free API code, that can be generated on site http://www.wunderground.com/weather/api/ Weather by Yahoo! or Open weather. Celsius or Fahrenheit in settings. Weather update every 20 min. Last time update of weather and location is available when Debug Mode in settings is turned ON.

latest_release.release_notes: Weather My Way edited by Zeduaz - INVERTED

data.title: Weather My Way edited by Zeduaz - INVERTED

data.description:
Time shown on the faces of cubes.

The hours are shown on 3 visible sides of 4 large blue cubes - count those that are "lit".  
5-minutes are shown in the same way on 4 medium-sized yellow cubes.  
Single minutes are shown on 4 small purple cubes - with a whole cube being "lit" for each minute.
AM/PM marker at the top shown from fragments of 2 additional small green cubes.

Screenshots: 7:19AM, 12:26AM, 3:53PM, 4:45PM, 10:21PM (with Quick View)

Designed by Peter Fletcher, who has designed watches for Tokyoflash and a number of the faces I have published.  The watchface has been produced with the designer and is published with his permission.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed defect where single minutes were not displaying cumulatively, but individually.  Thanks to Jordan Damewood for reporting the defect.

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Mirrored digits look complicated but aren't.
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

I mirrored the four classical digits twice, once horizontally and then once vertically. The resulting digits are point symmetric and look like glyphs from an unknown language. Sometimes they resemble Chinese. There are actually four ways to mirror the digits that result in symmetric digits. 

The reading rule is: concentrate on one of the 4 corners of each glyph depending on the watchface name. TL means top left, TR means top right, BL means bottom left and BR means bottom right. There you will find the well known number within the glyph. Once you know the trick, it's actually pretty easy. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Glyph TL Y

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Mirrored digits look complicated but aren't.
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

I mirrored the four classical digits twice, once horizontally and then once vertically. The resulting digits are point symmetric and look like glyphs from an unknown language. Sometimes they resemble Chinese. There are actually four ways to mirror the digits that result in symmetric digits. 

The reading rule is: concentrate on one of the 4 corners of each glyph depending on the watchface name. TL means top left, TR means top right, BL means bottom left and BR means bottom right. There you will find the well known number within the glyph. Once you know the trick, it's actually pretty easy. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Glyph BR R

changelog.release_notes: 1.2 - Pebble Time Round compatibility added (Bottom date partially cuts out, may be fixed in a future release).

data.description:
It's a watchface -- with Lemmings, from the classic Amiga game. Lemmings drop in, walk around, and eventually make their way to their home. The level restarts every minute with a random lemming flow rate. There is a random chance one of the lemmings will become a blocker, diverting the flow.

Constantly animated watchfaces can put a heavy drain on the battery but it is fun to show off.

Donate: 1JbxfRpG4iv3qscRe8wgFBXbNhmPesP723

latest_release.release_notes: 1.2 - Pebble Time Round compatibility added (Bottom date partially cuts out, may be fixed in a future release).

changelog.release_notes: Fixed issue that prevented mmol/L decimal values from displaying properly
SHARE Users - adds support for region selection in the watchface settings. G5 users outside USA can now view their CGM data.
fix for date/time format on Round (Chalk Hardware)
(NS) Fix issue that showed a raw BG instead of LOW

(NS) fixed delta calc for raw & special values
(NS) changed HVY noise text to ???
(ALL) Minor formatting changes

V2.0 adds raw support for NS users,
+Timeline entries for the most recent 12 BG values. Information varies by Source (Nightscout or Share)
+Fixes for communication failures & "stuck" checking issues.
+Minor UI tweaks

Added Nightscout Support to main release.

Nightscout Users:
go to settings, select Nightscout as your Mode and enter your pebble endpoint and remaining settings.

Thank you!

NEW for 1.6: Pebble Time Round Support

Simple CGM MUST NOT BE USED TO MAKE MEDICAL DECISIONS. THERE IS NO WARRANTY FOR THE PROGRAM, TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW. EXCEPT WHEN OTHERWISE STATED IN WRITING THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND/OR OTHER PARTIES PROVIDE THE PROGRAM “AS IS” WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE ENTIRE RISK AS TO THE QUALITY AND PERFORMANCE OF THE PROGRAM IS WITH YOU. SHOULD THE PROGRAM PROVE DEFECTIVE, YOU ASSUME THE COST OF ALL NECESSARY SERVICING, REPAIR OR CORRECTION. The watchface requires active use of the Share receiver with the Dexcom Share2 iOS application sending data to their cloud service. This watchface is both Time and Original Pebble compatible. After installation, you must open the settings for the watchface from within the Pebble smartphone app. SELECT “Share” as the mode. The other two options are not supported/functioning. ENTER your Dexcom account information. The username is not typically an email address, and can be found by opening the Share2 iOS app and tapping “Account.” NOTE: mmol/l has not been thoroughly tested, as Share is still US only. Set your High & Low Thresholds Set your Vibration type: “New & Alerts” will vibe for every new BG read (double vibe) and any new BG in the Alert ranges. “Alerts Only” will long vibe for each BG in the Alert ranges. There is no snooze option yet, so it will vibrate every 5 minutes if within the ranges. Click “Submit” The watchface will let you know if you have the account info wrong. For Time: out range High will show Yellow (circle) color, Low will be Red, in range is Green. For Original: out range High will show Black (circle) color as will Low, in range is a White circle (black text). SOME NOTES ON COMM ERROR: Comm Errors are specific to communication between the watch and the phone app. These occur when the watch face or the smartphone Pebble app isn’t functioning properly, or the Bluetooth messaging between them is failing. If the internet connection is down or causing the issue, you should see “net error” in the circle (where the BG delta usually is) and the BG will be blanked out. For comm errors: I open the pebble smartphone app, force quit and relaunch, cycle watchface. If it didn’t work: I turn Bluetooth off (on the phone), and back on again (airplane mode off and on does the trick too), force quit pebble app and relaunch. Cycle watchface. Still no luck? Power cycle both devices, relaunch pebble app after both are back and ready. Net errors: try your web browser, does it browse to websites? Try a website you never go to to verify you’re not hitting a cached site. On wifi? Turn it off and try on cellular only.

NEW for 1.5: Pebble Time now shows date & time as a string above BG info.

EXCEPT WHEN OTHERWISE STATED IN WRITING THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND/OR OTHER PARTIES PROVIDE THE PROGRAM “AS IS” WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. THE ENTIRE RISK AS TO THE QUALITY AND PERFORMANCE OF THE PROGRAM IS WITH YOU. SHOULD THE PROGRAM PROVE DEFECTIVE, YOU ASSUME THE COST OF ALL NECESSARY SERVICING, REPAIR OR CORRECTION. 

The watchface requires active use of the Share receiver with the Dexcom Share2 iOS application sending data to their cloud service. This watchface is both Time and Original Pebble compatible. After installation, you must open the settings for the watchface from within the Pebble smartphone app. 

SELECT “Share” as the mode. The other two options are not supported/functioning. 

ENTER your Dexcom account information. The username is not typically an email address, and can be found by opening the Share2 iOS app and tapping “Account.” 

NOTE: mmol/l has not been thoroughly tested, as Share is still US only. Set your High & Low Thresholds Set your Vibration type: “New & Alerts” will vibe for every new BG read (double vibe) and any new BG in the Alert ranges. “Alerts Only” will long vibe for each BG in the Alert ranges. There is no snooze option yet, so it will vibrate every 5 minutes if within the ranges. 

Click “Submit” The watchface will let you know if you have the account info wrong. 
For Time: out range High will show Yellow (circle) color, Low will be Red, in range is Green. 
For Original: out range High will show Black (circle) color as will Low, in range is a White circle (black text). 

SOME NOTES ON COMM ERROR: Comm Errors are specific to communication between the watch and the phone app. These occur when the watch face or the smartphone Pebble app isn’t functioning properly, or the Bluetooth messaging between them is failing. If the internet connection is down or causing the issue, you should see “net error” in the circle (where the BG delta usually is) and the BG will be blanked out. 
For comm errors: I open the pebble smartphone app, force quit and relaunch, cycle watchface. If it didn’t work: I turn Bluetooth off (on the phone), and back on again (airplane mode off and on does the trick too), force quit pebble app and relaunch. Cycle watchface. Still no luck? Power cycle both devices, relaunch pebble app after both are back and ready. 
Net errors: try your web browser, does it browse to websites? Try a website you never go to to verify you’re not hitting a cached site. On wifi? Turn it off and try on cellular only.

data.author: IQApps

changelog.release_notes:
Danish DMI decided to prevent reading weather through their API as JSON.

Openweathermap is now the source for weather info in this watchface.
Added option to mark current day with inverted colors or with a circle. Use setup to set the current day inverted.

Better digital clock digit positioning.
Better settingspage that remember your settings.
Icon, for this watchface, added to Pebble watchfaces menu.

Added settings page with several options.
Changed wind direction to letters like N,NØ,Ø,SØ,S,SV,V,NV.
Added % to humidity
Added function to enhance the light-on by tap or shake to 6 seconds instead of the default 3 seconds.

Fixed race condition issues when fetching data from Internet
Added Danish texts on watchface for errors when fetching data.

Fixed bluetooth symbol artifacts.
Fixed Calendar where only Sunday in current week was shifted to top line in calendar.
First release.

data.description:
Check regularly for new versions.

Use the "Version Information" menu below to see what has improved.

How to update to newest version: Uninstall the watchface and install it again. (Unload is not enough. This is on Pebble, I cannot push updates to you, sorry.)

This watchface is called "Just 4 Nicolai" because my son Nicolai had some special requirements.

The clock can be shown in digital or analog mode. This is configurable.

If you live in Denmark you may find this interesting.

The watchface get the weather information from DMI and show the info in Danish text. This is much more accurate than any other international weather service available.

You will also get a 3 week calender view, a battery state indicator and a charging indicator.

I have included a bluetooth disconnect alarm with a single vibrate and a 20 sec. flashing symbol. This alarm can be disabled,

Shaking your arm to turn on light, keeps the backlight on for some extra seconds, instead of the default 3 seconds. This is configurable.

Please use the contact developer option, if you have ideas or problems.

Enjoy...

latest_release.release_notes:
Danish DMI decided to prevent reading weather through their API as JSON.

Openweathermap is now the source for weather info in this watchface.

data.title: Just4Nicolai

data.author: Rob of the Sky People

changelog.release_notes:
This is my first working modification of MyNameIsKir's Binary Watch watchface for the Pebble Smart Watch (https://github.com/MyNameIsKir/Pebble-Binary-Watch-C). Most of the code is hers; I just fumbled around with some modifications--namely, I changed it from an 8-bit-per-line display to a 6-bit used a different, larger font added the old-school green-on-black "homebrew" color scheme and moved the date from a separate window and integrated it with the time display.

Many thanks to MyNameIsKir for her help and her work.

data.description: A quirky binary clock using images based on the Enchanted Tiki Room in the Disney parks.  The four birds on the vines represent the hours and the drummers and their drums represent the minutes.  The first screenshot shown gives you a look at all the images, the second screenshot shows you what 7:29 would look like.

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Hexagon based numbers for alien display
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:13, 07:36, 10:18, 18:25

XtalV is watchface that uses hexagon based numbers with some lines taken away. I arranged these symbols vertically which makes the display look cryptic, like an alien inscription. Once you know the numbers, the display is easy to read while it keeps its alien look throughout the day. XtalV is for minimalists, hexagon lovers and those with alien ancestors ;) 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow

data.author: Adrián Pérez

changelog.release_notes: This release adds a nifty battery bar and, most importantly, support for Pebble Time Round (“Chalk” platform).
Watchface is now configurable, and two new fonts for the beats display can now be selected.
Fixed calculations for UTC timezone offset and Internet Time. Now the @beats time value should be correct for all timezones.

Normal time display (HH:MM) uses now a slightly larger font, and respects 24h/12h setting. The beats display has now a custom font. Bluetooth status is now tracked, and a short vibration produced on disconnect events.

- Fixed calculation of @beats time.
- Added small display the time in usual HH:MM format (24h format only for now, no AM/PM).
- On Basalt (Pebble Time), the HH:MM text display has light gray color.
- Changed to black background.
Initial, very simple version.

data.description: Simple watchface which just shows the @beats Swatch Internet Time, alongside a traditional HH:MM display and a battery meter. The traditional display respects the 24h/12h time format setting. Vibrates on Bluetooth disconnect. Beats display font is configurable.

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Mirrored digits look complicated but aren't.
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

I mirrored the four classical digits twice, once horizontally and then once vertically. The resulting digits are point symmetric and look like glyphs from an unknown language. Sometimes they resemble Chinese. There are actually four ways to mirror the digits that result in symmetric digits. 

The reading rule is: concentrate on one of the 4 corners of each glyph depending on the watchface name. TL means top left, TR means top right, BL means bottom left and BR means bottom right. There you will find the well known number within the glyph. Once you know the trick, it's actually pretty easy. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Glyph TR G

data.author: Bronstrup Creative

changelog.release_notes:
FIXES: Full weekdays didn't fit with full months, so those are abbreviated now.  

NEW FEATURES: Configuration to allow for polling of shipping status for your Kickstarter-backed Pebble Time and/or Pebble Time Steel. Polling is done through my server every 5 minutes (yes, that means you need to trust me).

Readability improvements - Changed hand colors on Pebble Time and increased font size. Updated look of compass, battery bar, and bluetooth icon. One-second mode now remains active for a full minute, making the compass much more useful.

New features!

Added a compass (left), battery level indicator (middle), and bluetooth connection indicator (right) to the bottom of this face.

To conserve battery, each indicator only updates when the face updates. That means once per minute under normal conditions or once per second for 10 seconds after tapping the screen or switching to this face.

Compass - Arrow always points north. Arrow is solid when pointing to magnetic north and empty when pointing toward true north (this is based on whether your Pebble is able to identify true north).

Battery indicator - The battery level is displayed as a filled bar, red on Pebble Time, black on Pebble. When charging, the 100% area is outlined, dark red on Pebble Time, black on Pebble.

Bluetooth indicator - Only appears when connected, hidden otherwise.
Fixed off-center center dot and changed dot from filled square to drawn circle. Also re-alighned hands slightly.

Initial release.

Are you a member of Team Null, Pebble's unofficial "My Pebble Time Kickstarter Reward Tracking Number is Stuck as NULL" fan club? This watch face is for you!

It's in both black and white AND color, so you can use it today and, if you like it, keep using it when your Time finally arrives!

Features:
Battery-saver second hand - The second hand displays for 10 seconds when the watch is tapped on; after that, the face reverts to minutes-only mode to conserve battery.
Group acceptance and recognition - Immediately identify yourself to other Pebblers as someone who backed the Pebble Time Kickstarter campaign and has yet to receive their Pebble Time or, once you *do* get your Time, as one of the few, the proud, the... wait no, I can't use that, lest I find myself in military court... the many, the impatient, the NULL.

data.description:
Are you a member of Team Null, Pebble's unofficial "My Pebble Time Kickstarter Reward Tracking Number is Stuck as NULL" fan club? This watch face is for you!

Features:
 - Kickstarter NULL tracking - Checks every 5 minutes to see if your Time or Time Steel tracking number has appeared in your portal yet!
 - Compass - Arrow always points north. Arrow is solid when pointing to magnetic north and empty when pointing toward true north (this is based on whether your Pebble is able to identify true north).
 - Battery indicator - The battery level is displayed as a red bar. When charging, the 100% area is outlined in dark red.
 - Bluetooth indicator - Only appears when connected, hidden otherwise.
 - Battery-saver mode - The second hand displays and the compass, battery indicator, and bluetooth indicator are updated every second for 60 seconds when the watch is tapped on the face is activated; after that, the face reverts to minutes-only mode to conserve battery.
 - Group acceptance and recognition - Immediately identify yourself to other Pebblers as someone who backed the Pebble Time Kickstarter campaign and has yet to receive their Pebble Time or, once you *do* get your Time, as one of the few, the proud, the... wait no, I can't use that, lest I find myself in military court... the many, the impatient, the NULL.

latest_release.release_notes:
FIXES: Full weekdays didn't fit with full months, so those are abbreviated now.  

NEW FEATURES: Configuration to allow for polling of shipping status for your Kickstarter-backed Pebble Time and/or Pebble Time Steel. Polling is done through my server every 5 minutes (yes, that means you need to trust me).

data.title: Team Null "Official" Watchface

I mirrored the four classical digits twice, once horizontally and then once vertically. The resulting digits are point symmetric and look like glyphs from an unknown language. Sometimes they resemble Chinese. There are actually four ways to mirror the digits that result in symmetric digits. 

The reading rule is: concentrate on one of the 4 corners of each glyph depending on the watchface name. TL means top left, TR means top right, BL means bottom left and BR means bottom right. data.description:
A cute animated dog for your pebble watch. It show the time 24h/12h and date with a cute dog running around to make you happy. The app only consume power when you are using Pebble watch and otherwise the dog is sleeping and preserve power. If you like the app please support it by contributing on valtiel.com. It will be very appreciated and you will support me in making more updates with new animations.

Features: 
✔ Virtual pet and watch in a single app 
✔ Different animations and background events 
✔ Show date, time and battery status 
✔ Funny animations to watch and minimal battery use when inactive 
✔ More updates to come, follow on valtiel.com

Important note! The text "Valtiel.com" will disappear in the Pebble App if you add a user and contribute on valtiel.com  

If you love the watchface, please give it a <3 and follow the progress for next update at valtiel.com 
Thank you for using one of my Apps.
data.title: Fluffy Dog

data.author: Phil Devereux

changelog.release_notes:
Tweaks to text size, should fit pebble round a little better (work in progress) please report any errors or clipping to me
Other bug fixes

This update enables the watchface for Pebble Time Round
I don't have a Pebble Time Round to test this on myself so if you notice any big problems with it please let me know.

V1.3 - Bug Releases
Fixes error where time fields fail to populate when watchface is first started
Fixes error where the incorrect time is displayed at Noon or Midnight

V1.2 - Fixed bug displaying Twenty Five past and to
Implemented Framework for Animations - Coming Soon
V1.1 Corrected Naming Error

data.description:
This simple watchface displays the rough time in text, to the nearest five minutes. The Color changes every minute to keep the watch face looking fresh.

Todays date is also shown between the two lines.

Animations coming soon

latest_release.release_notes:
Tweaks to text size, should fit pebble round a little better (work in progress) please report any errors or clipping to me
Other bug fixes

data.description:
Japanese old art "Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji" watchface. Sun/Moon move like an hour hand. This watchface isn't corresponding to actual sunrise and sunset. This works as 6 to 18/18 to 6 twelve hours clock.

You can toggle hand and indexes on/off with tapping.
data.title: Fugaku

data.description:
Simple + Watch = Satch.

Battery friendly, easy to see, displays date, time, and day of the week.
data.title: Satch

data.description: Faciem uses Roman numerals and either English or Latin to display the time and date.  There is a config page so you can choose your preference.  It also includes a battery level indicator.

latest_release.release_notes: v1.4:  Fixed config not working in iOS.

data.title: Faciem

changelog.release_notes: corregido error de centrado de hora con 5 lineas
Cambio en los iconos de estado de la batería. Cada punto es un 10%.
Corregido problema a la hora de situar la hora en el centro de la pantalla

En esta nueva versión se usa la fuente órgano, se incluye un medidor de batería del reloj y se muestra un aviso cuando se pierde la señal de bluetooth con el teléfono. Cuando la batería del reloj está por debajo del 20% o se ha perdido la señal de bluetooth se invierten los colores.
Versión inicial

data.description:
NEW:
-5 More Awesome themes to choose from making a total of 20 themes!
-Third Text Size Added

FIX:
-Padding added round the edge to prevent bezel clipping text
-Battery life issues are hopefully resolved

Moment is your dynamic digital watch-face. The numbers fluidly transition every minute and there is a feature that turns the back-light on when the device charges which is useful if you have a Pebble Time compatible charging dock such as the TimeDock. Moment is a fun watch-face and I hope you like it just as much as I do! 24-Hour mode supported.
data.title: Moment

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble firmware 4, Pebble 2, Pebble Time Round and Quick Views.

data.description:
Bringing together my love of hexagons and triangles.

Easy to read, with hours shown in 2 hexagons in the upper half, 5-minute blocks in 2 hexagons in the lower half and the additional single minutes in the triangle between the 5-minute hexagons.

Time is always in 12-hour mode with 2 triangles between the hour hexagons indicating am (top) & pm (bottom).

The battery level is indicated on the line between the hours and minutes.  The color changes as the level reduces:
  - Green:  60% and above
  - Yellow:  30% - 50%
  - Red:       20% and below

The background shapes (i.e. those not lit for the time) have 3 options on the settings screen:
  - Dark gray
  - Light gray
  - Hidden

Screenshots show:  
 (1)   3:58 AM (dark gray shapes, battery 50%)
 (2)   9:54 AM (dark gray shapes, battery 20%)
 (3)   1:31 PM (hidden shapes, battery 20%)  
 (4) 12:15 AM (light gray shapes, battery 100%)
 (5)   7:43AM (with Quick View)


Design & Programming Copyright © 2015 Nev Rawlins

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble firmware 4, Pebble 2, Pebble Time Round and Quick Views.

data.title: Hexagons

data.description:
Electrocop is inspired from a classic Lynx game about robots, lasers and a giant circuit board world that your play in!

The watch features:

* Time
* Date
* Weather
* Battery Life
* Awesomeness on a screen
data.title: Electrocop
